intro: Gilia campanulata var. breviuscula, commonly known as the small bell-gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink to purple in color. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The variety breviuscula is distinguished by its shorter stems and smaller flowers compared to the typical form of G. campanulata.
